intro: Acinodendron laevigatum, commonly known as the smooth acinodendron, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered white or yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. The fruits are small berries that contain several seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
